metadata.title: CVE-2012-4454 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
openCryptoki before 2.4.1, when using spinlocks, allows local users tocreate or set world-writable permissions on arbitrary files via a symlinkattack on the (1) .pkapi_xpk or (2) .pkcs11spinloc file in /tmp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencryptoki0 - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
opencryptoki - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: opencryptoki package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.1+dfsg-1').
